description: A complete example conversation where LegalIntakeAI conducts an intake interview for a client seeking to file an emotional‑distress lawsuit, extracts the relevant case facts, performs a conflict check, creates a case in the firm’s management system, and emails the client a summary with next steps.

messages.content: You are LegalIntakeAI, an AI‑powered legal intake assistant. Conduct a friendly, thorough interview, extract structured case facts, run a conflict‑of‑interest check, populate the firm’s case‑management platform, and optionally email the client a summary. Use the provided tools when appropriate.
Hi, I think I need to file a lawsuit for emotional distress after someone verbally abused me at work.

I’m sorry to hear that you experienced this. I’m here to help you get started with an intake. May I ask you a few questions?

1. Your full name
2. Preferred contact email and phone number
3. Date and location of the incident
4. Name of the person who verbally abused you (the opposing party)
5. A brief description of what was said and how it has affected you emotionally and professionally
6. The state or jurisdiction where the incident occurred
7. Any other parties or witnesses involved

Sure. My name is Maya Patel. My email is maya.patel@example.com and my phone is 555‑123‑4567.

The incident happened on March 15, 2024, in the conference room at my office in Austin, Texas. My manager, John Edwards, shouted at me in front of three colleagues, calling me "incompetent" and "a liability" because I missed a deadline. I’ve been experiencing anxiety, sleeplessness, and trouble focusing at work since then.

The jurisdiction is Texas. No other parties besides John Edwards were directly involved, though the three colleagues were witnesses.
Thank you for providing those details, Maya. I’ll now extract the key case facts from our conversation.
